records.location_details: Incident started with crossing from Bulgaria to Serbia, detention in 'Belnanwaz detention center' in Belgrade, transfer to Serbia-Bulgaria border near Pirot, apprehension and mistreatment in Pirot outskirts, forced return to Bulgaria.
records.where_clear: Serbia-Bulgaria border area, including Pirot and Belgrade in Serbia.
records.location_text_raw: Bulgaria to Serbia, Belnanwaz detention center in Belgrade, Serbia-Bulgaria border, Pirot city in Serbia, Pirot outskirts, Bulgaria.
records.uncertainty_note: The Fundamental Rights Office cannot establish with certainty that the alleged incidents occurred. Serbian authorities state no detention center named 'Belnanwaz' exists and could not confirm the incident.
records.context_note: A group of 20 migrants, including the interviewee, was allegedly detained in Serbia from 2024-02-04, transferred to the Serbia-Bulgaria border on 2024-02-15, stripped of belongings, and ordered to cross to Bulgaria. The interviewee was later apprehended near Pirot on 2024-02-16, physically mistreated by Serbian police, and again forced to return to Bulgaria. The Fundamental Rights Office notes the Serbian authorities' inability to confirm the incident or the existence of the mentioned detention center.
records.evidence_quote: During a screening interview performed by Frontex, a screened person stated that a group of 20 nationals, including himself, was detained for ten days in Serbia. After that, on 15/02/2024 the group was allegedly transferred to the Serbia-Bulgaria border, where the Serbian police confiscated their belongings, forced them to remove their clothes, and ordered them to cross to Bulgaria.
